intro: Cryptoglochin curvulus, commonly known as the curly cryptogloch, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, curling leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Cryptoglochin curvulus is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
